column2: Akaviri and Tsaeci merchants ships are a common sight in this port, plying their trade in the waters of the Strait of Lautah, the Topara River, and the Far Sea.
The Meratsies River has long been a conduit for trade, and flat-bottomed riverboats loaded with goods fill the ports along the river's course.
Trade and troops alike flow along ancient roads here, most of which were built to lead to Voltara, one of the oldest cities in all of Akavir.
Roads and trails laboriously cut through the mountains and jungles of southern Akavir.

Caravanserais dot the lake-oases of the desert, with troops and trade flowing over the dunes along well-treaded caravan routes.
